alternatives.transcript: from our television news station this is Action News midday with Aida Amaura and Bryce Anderson Congress has a wide variety of taxes from which to choose some fair and some unfair one organization is fighting politicians in Washington to make sure that taxes are fair and don't increase the burden on the average working American with me this noon as David Wilhelm he is executive director of the consumer tax Alliance he's

Omaha today to discuss the federal budget situation and tax policy something that everybody can relate to if they pay any kind of taxes at all what would you consider an unfair tax well an unfair tax would be a tax on the kind of products that average families use every day one of the taxes that people in Washington are talking about increasing as the federal beer tax other people are talking about increasing the federal gasoline tax others see the cigarette taxes and easy target those are the kinds of taxes but take five six seven times as

greater share out of the pockets of middle income families as they do out of the pockets of the very wealthy and we think that's the wrong way to go but someone would say to you what what should we tax because they always use the threat of possible program cuts and if they can't do these kind of attacks as well right now they're looking for a fifty billion dollar down payment on the deficit the deficit to two hundred billion dollars or more half of it from spending cuts half of it from tax increases the kind of thing that we think audit ought to be the

Target of attacks increase Oddity but Donald Trump's or the Mars family's of the world's the richest families in America for instance right now people who make between 75 and 200,000 dollars pay a 33 percent rate on that income people who make an excess of two hundred thousand dollars a year pays Twenty Eight percent rate at a minimum at a bare minimum we ought to have millionaires paying the same rate as people who make less than two hundred thousand dollars a year that's the way we think the deficit reduction process not to go

go now you your organization has been responsible I think I believe for the commercials where you talk about the people that are having the beer party or whatever in the they're getting taxed but yet you look at the Lamborghinis and when they're not as you know tax on that at all right how what the response been on that commercial it's been a great response very gratifying response in fact we did a poll of people in Nebraska and we found out that after seeing those ads and understanding that it's consumers not the companies that they're the burden of these taxes

those Texas grew to a two to one level and when we ask the question do you support an increase in the maximum tax rate on people who make more than two hundred thousand dollars a year the support for that proposal Nebraska was 9 to 1 so we're going to be taking that data and showing it to members of Congress is the whole purpose of the commercial together the data or is the purpose of the commercial to gather some kind of support Financial or whatever to take to Washington both the purpose of the commercial is to educate the public

Public on what's at stake two weeks from now Congress is going to reconvene the budget Summit is going to reconvene and the question is who would bear the burden of any additional tax increase should it be the average working family in Nebraska or ought we asked the most fortunate among us to begin bearing a greater share of the burden a couple of final things I guess you know now you have something working against you which is basically the Persian Gulf crisis people are saying well will pay a little extra for you know

is that going to work against you or not well you know the deficit is getting larger and larger every day it's 50 billion dollars larger because we have to bail out the Savings and Loan it's going to be several billions dollars a larger because of what's going on in the Mideast the fact of the matter is middle-income people we know are going to be asked to pay their fair share what we're trying to do is change the terms of the debate somewhat so that we look to others as well to share an Indian Creek where are you speaking today
doing a little media tour talking to other television stations in the radio talk shows on Talk of the Town just an hour ago so that's what we're doing alright thanks a lot thanks for being with us
